content.text: Hardware Upgrades for the Human Body
“All augmentations are performed at your own risk. Side effects may include enhanced combat performance, existential dread, and occasional involuntary corporate servitude.“
How This Document Works

This is a framework with a starter catalog. Each tier has clear power-budget rules that define what an augment at that level should do. We ship 4-5 example augments per tier per tree. GMs and players can homebrew more — as long as they follow the tier guidelines.
The compendium is a starting point. Not a cage.
Universal Rules
Tier Unlock Requirements
Tier Augments in Power Level Lore Tree
T1 0 (entry) Minor Entry-level mods. Corp-standard. Minimal body stress.
T2 1 Moderate Body adapted to baseline. Pushing past standard issue.
T3 3 Significant Serious integration. Your body is purpose-built now.
T4 6 Major Experimental territory. Corps watch you closely at this level.
T5 (Mastery) 10 Capstone Full tree integration. Passive, always-on. You are the augment. ----------------- ----------------- ----------------- -----------------
Tier Power Budgets
These define what’s appropriate at each level. Homebrew augments should stay within these bounds.

T1 — Minor Adjustments • +1 to a specific stat check or combat value (conditional) • +1 HP • Small utility effect (skill bonus, minor sensing) • Cannot: Grant flat accuracy/damage to all attacks, modify death mechanics T2 — Meaningful Upgrades • +2 HP or +1 Evasion/Armor (conditional or capped) • +1 to accuracy/damage under a specific trigger (wounded, after kill, vs marked, etc.) • Reduce a penalty by 1-2 (off-hand, scar debuffs) • Conditional extra die (once per combat or situational) • Cannot: Stack unconditionally, grant extra actions T3 — Defining Abilities • +1-2 accuracy or +1 damage die under a broad trigger • New combat option (bonus attack on specific trigger, special movement) • Significant utility (disable enemy augments, short teleport conditions) • Scale with another mechanic (per-scar bonus, per-stack bonus) • Cannot: Guarantee crits, bypass death mechanics entirely T4 — Powerful Specializations • Healing on trigger (1d4 on kill, 1d6 once per combat) • Bonus attacks on crit or kill • Major defensive option (survive lethal once per mission) • Powerful conditional (double effect stacks, ignore armor once) • Trade-off augments live here — big bonus, real cost • Cannot: Guarantee survival, provide unlimited actions T5 — Mastery (Capstone) • Always-on passive. No activation, no cost. • Modifies a core mechanic permanently (death rolls, crit thresholds, evasion floors) • Should feel like the culmination of the entire tree • One per tree. You only get this through deep commitment. • Must: Be powerful but not game-breaking. Reward investment, not replace other systems.
Trade-Off Augments
Any tier can contain trade-off augments (bonus + cost). Guidelines:

• T1-T2: Small bonus, minor cost (e.g., +1 accuracy, -1 evasion) • T3-T4: Significant bonus, significant cost (e.g., +2 accuracy all, +1 auto-scar per mission) • The cost should be from a different system than the bonus (accuracy bonus → HP cost, not accuracy bonus → accuracy cost)
Homebrew Template
When creating new augments, follow this format:

\`\`\` Name: \[Augment Name\] Tree: \[Tree\] \| Tier: \[1-5\] \| Install Cost: \[credits\] Effect: \[Mechanical effect\] Trade-off (if any): Bonus: \[X\] / Cost: \[Y\] Lore: \[One-line flavor text\] Guideline Check: \[Which T# budget rule does this follow?\] \`\`\`
